summary: When parents can't care for their children, relatives often step in as caregivers. To help these caregivers, states can access federal matching funds if they operate programs Health and Human Services determines to be evidence based. This requires states to evaluate programs to show positive impacts for families. But as of December 2022, no states have accessed these funds. Officials from all 5 states we...
title: Child Welfare: HHS Is Taking Steps to Help States Support Relative Caregivers with Evidence-Based Programs
